intro: Sebastiania granatensis, commonly known as the granadilla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange berries that contain a single seed. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in umbels. The fruit is not only ornamental but also has been used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dye.
